Package slogo.compiler

Interface SLogoRunnable

All Known Implementing Classes:
DoTimesCommand, EvaluateNumberCommand, ForCommand, ForwardCommand, IfCommand, IfElseCommand, LessCommand, MakeCommand, PenDownCommand, RepeatCommand, SLogoCommand, SLogoFunction, SLogoUserDefinedCommand, SLogoUserDefinedFunction, SumCommand, ToCommand, TowardsCommand, XCorCommand
public interface SLogoRunnable
An interface that marks an object as runnable and expects 0 or more parameters.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean giveNextExpectedToken​(SLogoToken token)
    Gives the runnable the next Token it expects as a parameter.
    boolean isReady()
    Indicates whether a SLogoRunnable is ready to be run based on whether it has the correct parameters.
    SLogoToken run()
    Depending on the concrete implementation, this either performs a single action or is a recursive method that runs all nested SLogoRunnable type objects.

  • Method Details

    • isReady

      boolean isReady()
      Indicates whether a SLogoRunnable is ready to be run based on whether it has the correct parameters. A runnable is initialized with no parameters by the Parser class, but the Function class will continuously call isReady() on each of its runnable objects and give them parameters until they are ready to be run.
      Returns:
      - true if the given parameters match the expected number and type(s), false otherwise

    • giveNextExpectedToken

      boolean giveNextExpectedToken​(SLogoToken token)
      Gives the runnable the next Token it expects as a parameter. For example, the fd command expects a constant or variable, so calling this method with one of those Token types will cause isReady() to return true and allow the command to be properly run. By contract, it is the Function class's responsibility to call this method with a proper Token type (i.e. by wrapping return values from a command into a Constant object).
      Parameters:
      token - - a Token expected by the Command as a parameter

    • run

      SLogoToken run()
      Depending on the concrete implementation, this either performs a single action or is a recursive method that runs all nested SLogoRunnable type objects.
      Returns:
      the return value of the last SLogoRunnable object ran, wrapped in a Constant token object.
